. First mentioned in the 15th century as a small private manor, it has grown to become a lively place with about 8000 inhabitants. There's not that much to see in the town itself, but it can serve as a base for viewing the attractions of nearby villages, including the splendid Gothic Revival church of Gierwiaty and the Baroque heritage of Worniany, Bystryca and Michaliszki.
Gudogaj train station is about 3 km from the town centre.

value: content=Built around 1785, this Catholic church is rather typical of Neoclassical style. Some alterations in the structure remind of the late 19th century when the church was temporarily Orthodox.
